Ex...

blocks.data:
Creates a *Subscriber*.

**Required Fields**
* email

**Read Only Fields**
* id

### OAuth Scopes
|  **UI Name** | **Permission** | **Parameter** |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  Customers | modify | `store_v2_customers` |
|  Customers | read-only | `store_v2_customers_read_only` |

### Headers

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Client`|`client_id`|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

### Example

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-Auth-Client: {client_id}
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

* For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication). 
* **Name**: X-Auth-Token
* **Location**: header

data.description: The model for a POST to create a subscriber.

id.description: The unique numeric ID of the subscriber; increments sequentially.

email.description: The email of the subscriber. Must be unique.

first_name.description: The first name of the subscriber.

last_name.description: The last name of the subscriber.

source.description: The source of the subscriber. Values are: `storefront`, `order`, or `custom`.

order_id.description: The ID of the source order, if source was an order.

data.title: Subscriber Post

id.description: The unique numeric ID of the subscriber; increments sequentially.

email.description: The email of the subscriber. Must be unique.

first_name.description: The first name of the subscriber.

last_name.description: The last name of the subscriber.

source.description: The source of the subscriber. Values are: `storefront`, `order`, or `custom`.

order_id.description: The ID of the source order, if source was an order.

date_modified.description: The date on which the subscriber was modified.

date_created.description: The date of which the subscriber was created.

meta.description: Empty meta object; may be used later.
meta.title: Meta

blocks.data: The `Subscriber` was in conflict with another subscriber. This is the result of duplicate unique values, such as email.
